fields.description:
I have imported custom workflow via .xml-file. New status which I use in this custom workflow are not created in the list of statuses after import.
And when I try to change issue's statuses (when I change project's workflow) I not see new statuses.
Also when I create these new statuses manually, they are not appered in the list of statuses of this imported workflow.
fields.summary: Not created "New Statuses" while importing workflow via XML

fields.description:
* Load a filter in the issue navigator
* From the 'Views' menu, select 'RSS (Issues)'
* Subscribe to this in a feed reader

My generated feed URL is https://jira.atlassian.com/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-rss/16802/SearchRequest-16802.xml?tempMax=200

My Feed Reader (NetNewsWire) gives a 500 error.

This started happening to my existing feeds on 17 Jan (no new updates loaded since then).
fields.summary: RSS Feeds from JAC are returning 500 internal server error
Update Team Calendars integration (a.k.a. Jira ical feed) to version 1.0.12

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Try to import a backup zip file into JIRA

h3. Expected Results:
# The restore proceeds every time

h3. Actual Results:
# Most times the restore window just switches over to the finish window asking to login again (screenshot attached) without actually restoring anything.

h3. Workaround
# Attempt the restore again and it succeeds.
fields.summary: XML Restore of JIRA Fails The First Time

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Do a bulk move of issues from one project to another both sharing *the same* configuration (all schemes)

h3. Expected Results:
# Since the same issue types are present in both the projects, there is no need for an additional section for issue type (This is a regression error, verified that this works in 4.4.5)

h3. Actual Results:
# The screen that shows the Project vs Issue Type selection does not select the same issue type by default which is already present in the destination project and throws the error shown in attachment.

h3. Workaround
# Manually select the issue type in the destination project for each of the source issue types.
fields.summary: Issue Type Not Selected While Moving Issues
Update OnDemand Outgoing Mail handler to not report localhost in email headers
eliminate the JQL "IN" and "WAS IN" operators

fields.description:
h3.Resume
When a new Crowd User tries to login in JIRA, which Directory has *Default Group Memberships*, Crowd automatically adds this user to the Default Groups.

h3.Problem
When JIRA is configured to use SSO from Crowd this stops working. JIRA logs:
{code}
2013-01-21 17:52:37,362 main      JIRA 5.1.6 build: 785 started. You can now access JIRA through your web browser.
2013-01-21 17:54:43,276 http-8444-1 anonymous 1074x1x1 - 127.0.0.1 /rest/gadget/1.0/login HttpSession created [1u261wn]
2013-01-21 17:54:43,740 http-8444-1 anonymous 1074x1x1 - 127.0.0.1 /rest/gadget/1.0/login The user 'admin' is required to answer a CAPTCHA elevated security check.  Failure count equals 6
2013-01-21 17:54:53,707 http-8444-1 anonymous 1074x3x1 1u261wn 127.0.0.1 /rest/gadget/1.0/login login : 'admin' tried to login but they do not have USE permission or weren't found. Deleting remember me cookie.
2013-01-21 17:54:53,885 http-8444-1 anonymous 1074x3x1 1u261wn 127.0.0.1 /rest/gadget/1.0/login The user 'admin' has FAILED authentication.  Failure count equals 7
2013-01-21 17:55:02,987 http-8444-1 anonymous 1075x5x1 1u261wn 127.0.0.1 /rest/gadget/1.0/login login : 'admin' tried to login but they do not have USE permission or weren't found. Deleting remember me cookie.
2013-01-21 17:55:03,019 http-8444-1 anonymous 1075x5x1 1u261wn 127.0.0.1 /rest/gadget/1.0/login The user 'admin' has FAILED authentication.  Failure count equals 8
{code}

h3.Note
Users that have already authenticated with JIRA and Crowd, can login just fine, and SSO works flawlessly, Users who have yet to login will fail endlessly.

h3.Environment
JIRA 5.1.6
Crowd 2.5.2
fields.summary: Default Group Membership (From Crowd) does not work with SSO

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31385].
  {panel}

As of now, only emails creating comments can have regex settings that allow to truncate the irrelevant part of the message. It would be useful to be able to to the same when creating new issues from email.


*Example use case:*
JIRA is used as a support system. If the support team is contacted by their customer, they can send to them an email with the body beginning with something like:
{quote}
*--
Please write above this line.

Dear user,
Thanks for contacting support.
Please enter your issue description and attach relevant screenshots.

Thanks,
Your support team.

--*
{quote}

Reply to that email is received by Jira and triggers creating a new issue, with only the text above *-- as description.
fields.summary: Split regex in Create a new issue handler
Add JQL LIMIT support

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31383].
  {panel}

We have defined for each transition own screens with some validation rules. For example we defined a transitions with a screen, with 10 custom fields and corresponding validation rules. So a user can only perform the transition if he fill out all fields. 

So if a employee tries to perform this transition a transition screen pops up which contains all 10 fields. The employee will fill out the first 9 fields. Now he realizes that he has not the information for the 10th field. This is a big problem, because he must press the cancel-button. The validation rule of the 10th field does not allow to perform the transition and a save/update of the current fields is not possible. So he has to discard all changes....

This is not really fine for the usability, because this is "idle power". He has to fill out all 9 fields again, if he knows the information of the 10th field... :-(

It would be great if we can have a save/update button (or a Cancel & Save-Button whatever) to prevent unnecessary work.
fields.summary: Save Button for Transition Screen

fields.description:
The JIRA Pie Gadget, when configured against Assignees, does not count issues that are reopened.
When the pie slice gets eaten (clicked ;)) the filter shows status=open instead of resolution unresolved.
fields.summary: Pie Gadget does not include reopened issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31379].
  {panel}

Now, we can enable or disable GreenHopper on JIRA.
When GreenHopper is invalid, all projects of JIRA is not shown 'Agile' menu.

We hope that the 'Agile' menu is shown when A-project is selected and the 'Agile' menu is hidden when B-project is selected.

We want to decide whether we use 'Agile' menu depending on a JIRA project.
fields.summary: Hide 'Agile' menu of GreenHopper depending on a JIRA project.
Add keyboard shortcuts to change the issue tab panel

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31376].
  {panel}

Expected: The recipient's language should be used.

To reproduce:
Create a comment as a user with a language other than the system default (e.g Spanish). Set a security level on it.
As a user with the system default language (e.g. English), watch that issue, the user should be able to see the comment.
As the Spanish user, delete the comment.
Bug: The English user will get an email with the Spanish text "Se ha borrado un comentario con nivel de seguridad 'atlassian-staff'." instead of soemthing like "The user has deleted a comment with security level 'atlassian-staff'" (that text is probably not the actual English translation of that).
fields.summary: JIRA mail uses the sender's language instead of the recipient's language when sending mail

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Open a saved filter (but not shared) in Issue Navigator
# Click the Permlink icon !https://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/185729658/link-icon.gif?version=3&modificationDate=1358118192800&api=v2!

h3. Expected Results:
# The url includes just the JQL for the results (as in earlier version of JIRA, e.g. 5.1.8)

h3. Actual Results:
# It includes the filterid and also the JQL and it breaks the link if it is shared to other users (as the filter is not shared)

h3. Workaround
# Manually copy the JQL, click New Filter, paste the JQL, search and then share the Permlink
fields.summary: Issue Navigator Permlink Includes Filter Id
NoOpServlet should serve the standard 404 page
Version Description - add a new line
As an Administrator I Would Like Not to Start the JIRA Service After Installer Completes
Notification for EOL status
Edit Issue Collector directly in JIRA
Configurable option to disable create issue popup
Outgoing emails not threading in Outlook when connected to Exchange Server
Add a simple way for test cases to get the value of a Java "system property" from the target Jira

fields.description:
h4. Summary
If a username contains the symbol '#', @user mention will not show the user's full name in an issue, whether in the Description or Comment field.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Create a user with user name 'us#r' and full name 'Test User'.
# Make sure all permission is granted so @user mention can be used in the issue.
# Mention [@us#r] in description or comment. 
# Only [~us#r] will be shown and clicking the username will not direct to the user's profile.

h4. Cause of issue
* When a '#' is used, JIRA will read it as an Anchor Link, thus redirects to http://<jira-url>/browse/<project-id>#r
fields.summary: @User Mention does not show Full Name if User Name contains '#'
Make Issue Links with insufficient permissions visible

fields.description:
We are integrating Jira with one of other system and using SOAP API.
When calling updateIssue, randomly connection reset error comes and sync stops.

We debugged client's Jira instance and figured out that whenever current user sessions were going high, it resulted into connection error randomly.
(There were 9000 SOAP user sessions open even though we always do logout after calling any API.)

When open user sessions are low, we are not getting connection issue
fields.summary: Connection reset error coming randomly from UpdateIssue

fields.description:
This bug is continuation of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-30994 to address the performance issue for instance having more than 1000 custom fields when using JIRA on IE 8.

While this is continuously being improved by Atlassian, we recommend the following suggestions:
# Use another browser or later version of IE
# Reduce the number custom field to below 1000 custom fields. Check this [tips and tricks|http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7t44mPykXek] to reduce the number of custom fields.
# Get rid of the timeout message by increasing that timeout as per this Microsoft KB: http://support.microsoft.com/kb/175500 

If all else fails you could try installing [Chrome Frame|https://developers.google.com/chrome/chrome-frame/] into IE 8 browsers - however there are a couple of known issues with the Chrome Frame.
fields.summary: More than 1000 custom fields makes issue nav really slow in IE8

1. Navigating to application URL 
2. Schedule tab

fields.description:
The current Kuali Rice development project ReleaseNote query is not working correctly, as it pulls in JIRAs that are not completely fixed. 
https://jira.kuali.org/secure/ReleaseNote.jspa?projectId=10220&version=16606
It should limit the JIRAs to only those which have a resolution of Complete or Fixed. In addition, subtasks should be ignored. The following query will do this:
project = KULRICE AND fixVersion = "2.1.3" AND status = Resolved and resolution in (Complete, Fixed) and type != "Sub Task" ORDER BY priority, key DESC
fields.summary: Kuali Rice Release Notes Query Imporovement

fields.description:
On Jira 5 versions, when you have filter results, click the "views" dropdown, then select "Printable View."  This occurs on Firefox and IE, but I did not test on Chrome. 

Steps to reproduce:
Go to jira.atlassian.com
Create a filter and display the results
Click the "views" dropdown.
Select "Printable View"
Try to click on a link.

I was super-frustrated (along with many other folks here at Chegg) because everything looks exactly like it should be clickable (including hover behavior, different link color, etc.) yet you can't click.

Looking at the source, I saw at the bottom that you just strip away the click handlers. If you're going to create a page that looks like it has a certain behavior, then please strip away all the visual cues instead of just stripping the behavior.

Is it possible to add a parameter to the 'printable view' that would allow the consistent behavior?
fields.summary: Printable View links are not clickable in filter results
Add parent issue link to email template if subtask

h4.Expected Behaviour

We would like to be able to associate Workflows with Project Roles either.
fields.summary: Associate workflow to Project Roles

fields.description:
The following plugins are required by JIRA, but have not been started: Atlassian JIRA - Plugins - Project Config Plugin (com.atlassian.jira.jira-project-config-plugin), Embedded Gadgets Plugin (com.atlassian.gadgets.embedded), Gadget Dashboard Plugin (com.atlassian.gadgets.dashboard), Opensocial Plugin (com.atlassian.gadgets.opensocial), Gadget Directory Plugin (com.atlassian.gadgets.directory), Atlassian JIRA - Plugins - Gadgets Plugin (com.atlassian.jira.gadgets)


I have tried the answer on this page but to no avail.
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Installation+Troubleshooting+Guide


I HAVE RESOLVED THIS ISSUE.
IT WAS SOME PLUGINs TIMING OUT SO I FOLLOWED THE ADVICE REGARDING SETTING THE TIMEOUT PARAMETER FOR PLUGINS IN...

   <jira_install dir>/bin/setenv.sh 

I added...

    -Datlassian.plugins.enable.wait=300

Problems went away, now running fine.
fields.summary: The following plugins are required by JIRA, but have not been started
Bug in JIRA

fields.description:
Since today the screenshot applet give a certificate error when users try to use the applet:
!cert.png!

Can we update this certificate?
fields.summary: The screenshot applet's digital signature / certificate has expired

fields.description:
Basically, today I have receive 2 issue regarding on certificate error for screenshot applet in JIRA. User complaint that they already follow the exact instruction on this knowledge base article: [Certificate Error in JIRA Screenshot Applet|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Certificate+Error+in+JIRA+Screenshot+Applet]
However, the certificate for screenshot Applet on latest JIRA version which is 5.2.4.1 is already expired on 17 January 2013.

To verify this:
* Download the latest JIRA version 5.2.4.1 archive version in [here|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/downloads/binary/atlassian-jira-5.2.4.1.zip]
* Go to {{atlassian-jira\secure\applet\jira-screenshot-applet-5.2.4.jar}}
* Extract {{jira-screenshot-applet-5.2.4.jar}}
* Then you will found {{C:\atlassian-jira-5.2.4-standalone\atlassian-jira\secure\applet\jira-screenshot-applet-5.2.4\META-INF\ATLASSIA.RSA}}
* Open internet explorer, tools > internet options > under content tab
* click on certificates > import > browse to the {{ATLASSIA.RSA}} > next > select Automatically select the cerificate store based on the type of certificate > next > finish
* Go back to certificate > under other people tab > select the Atlassian Pty Ltd > click view

Here you go the screenshot attached which is showing *1 / 17 / 2013* as the expiration.
fields.summary: Certificate for Screenshot Applet on latest JIRA version Expired

fields.description:
We are using diffrent *security levels* in our jira system, because we are working with external partners who should not be able to see all comments in a jira issue.

The problem is:
When creating an new issue with *security level* _intern_ and *agent* _external user_ and *creator* _intern user_, the issue is created but our external partner cant see it in fact of the security level. (The correct *security level* would be _external_)

It would be nice to have a validation (checking security level and user/user group by creating an issue) for this problem (for example like the validation by the _watching issue_ function)
fields.summary: Checking the security level and the user by creating an issue

As a result, no values are presented.
(see Disable_Collect_Info.PNG as a result).

If a user enables the Collect Browser Info, the custom trigger works (see Enable_Collect_Info.PNG).

fields.description:
The ZIP-format file will not be able to access after a JIRA upgrade if the ZIP file was attached from an email and not manually in the issue by going to _More Actions > Attach file_. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue from email with ZIP file attached named (Issue A)
#* The mime type is {{APPLICATION/x-zip-compressed}}
# Create an issue using JIRA UI and attach the ZIP file using _More Actions > Attach file_ (Issue B)
#* The mime type is {{application/zip}}
# Create a backup XML
# Configure a new JIRA test instance
# If you're installing JIRA standalone, please copy the {{data}} directory to the new JIRA_HOME directory
# Restore the backup XML on the new JIRA test instance

In the new JIRA test instance, you will see that there is no option to click to drop-down the access of the ZIP file content on Issue A (mimezip1.PNG).  However, you will be able to see the ZIP file content on Issue B(mimezip2.PNG and mimezip3.PNG).

I'm able to reproduce this when upgrading from
* JIRA 5.0.4 to JIRA 5.2.4
* JIRA 5.1.8 to JIRA 5.2.4
fields.summary: ZIP-format file not able to access after upgrade

1. Create an issue
2. Set "Original Estimate" to maybe 3h
3. Resolve Issue

After this the "original Estimate" is deleted.

Shouldn't the Original Estimate remain 3h so I can log work on the issue later?

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31338].
  {panel}

Hi,

Since generally the "Create Issue" screens for our projects tend to have multiple tabs with lots of fields, when one creates a new issue he has to scroll down a bit to get to the last field on the screen. Though, what we've learned is that people tend to forget about the other tabs when creating a new issue since when scrolling down the tabs bar disappears. 

I think it would we of great help if the tab bar would have a fixed position (same as for the "Create Issue" banner at the top of the screen).

Thanks,
Petru

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31334].
  {panel}

A status change can be assigned one of two effects via a specific link type to another issue.
Effect 1 - set the workflow of the linked issue to a specific state and hold it locked
Effect 2 - set the workflow of the linked issue to a specific state but leave it free to be changed by the users

Use case:

Workflow with an additional "blocked" state.

When a link between issues is "blocks"/"is blocked by" then any state in the source issue other than resolved or closed sets the target issue to the blocked state and holds it locked.

If the source issue is set to resolved or closed and the target issue is in the blocked state, and there are no other block state dependencies, then the target issue is moved to the open state and the workflow of the target issue becomes free to change.

Value:

Chains of issues can be set up and their blocked and unblocked state can be seen quickly in an issues list. This mechanism can, of course, be performed in JIRA with a manual procedure and a modified workflow. However people are free to get it wrong and have to do some tedious editing when changing the state of certain key issues with lots of "blocks" links.

Note:
If multiple state forcings can apply to an issue from multiple links and workflow states there needs to be a priority ordering.
fields.summary: Automatic Status Change via Link Types

fields.description:
I am at the start point of the OAuth process, requesting a Request Token. The problem is that Jira 5.1 filters are eating my request, in other words, the Jira filters prevent that the request for the Request token completes.

My code is in a Jira plug-in that should manage the OAuth flow in this context: http://myserver:8080/rest/oslc/latest/oauth/, and example of the Request Token would be: http://myserver:8080/rest/oslc/latest/oauth/request_token.

Is there a Jira filter that catches the URLs with strings containing "oauth" in the address? How does it work?
Or is Jira looking for a Header in the request in order to check for OAuth requests?

Could somebody help to understand how/why the Jira server is handling these OAuth requests? I do not want that Jira deals with them, my plug-in should handle the OAuth requests by itself (of course, as long as they reach its app context).

More info

Description
I have a plug-in that uses OAuth, so a Change Management (CM) application using REST can consume/link Issues from Jira using OAuth. The plug-in that I have is like a middle man to provide REST services to the CM app.

Expected behavior
My plug-in works with Jira 4.2, the OAuth works well there. But when I deploy my plug-in into Jira 5.1, something goes wrong with the OAuth process.

I have my plug-in handling the OAuth authentication without Jira intervention. But it looks like there is a Jira OAuth filter that is preventing me to complete my request for the Request Token.

Workaround:
-I had to change my plug-in filter weight so my code runs before the Jira filters.
-I had to modify my code, so when the oauth request arrives in the context of my plug-in, I stop the filter chain (something that I do not really wanted to do) so Jira does not eats the request and prevent that the process flows. If the filter flows naturally after my code is reached, Jira filters eat my request.

Jira Server logs
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 2012-12-18 15:05:18,403 http-2990-8 WARN anonymous 897x945x1 8po31g X.X.XX.XXX /rest/oslc/latest/oauth/request_token [remoteapps.modules.oauth.OAuth2LOAuthenticator] Exception authenticating request
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] net.oauth.OAuthException: Unknown consumer: f51bccc75a1f82c2cc514f8fe92e1b2d
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] at com.atlassian.labs.remoteapps.OAuthLinkManager.validateOAuth2LORequest(OAuthLinkManager.java:123)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] at com.atlassian.labs.remoteapps.modules.oauth.OAuth2LOAuthenticator.authenticate(OAuth2LOAuthenticator.java:86)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] at com.atlassian.labs.remoteapps.modules.oauth.OAuth2LOFilter.mayProceed(OAuth2LOFilter.java:100)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] at com.atlassian.labs.remoteapps.modules.oauth.OAuth2LOFilter.doFilter(OAuth2LOFilter.java:58)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.DelegatingPluginFilter.doFilter(DelegatingPluginFilter.java:74)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.IteratingFilterChain.doFilter(IteratingFilterChain.java:42)

My plug-in does have a consumer registered with the key showed in the log, but as the Jira server does not (and I do not need to register it) the app fails to continue with the OAuth process.

Thanks in advance
fields.summary: Jira OAuth filter prevents me to follow the OAuth flow in Jira 5.1

fields.description:
{panel}
This issue deals with how JIRA manages session requests to the REST/SOAP API. 
The related issue JRA-27050 deals with session management for web Crawlers. 
The related issue JRA-27047 deals with session management for stateless requests to the REST/SOAP API.
{panel}

h4. Expected behavior
1. On first request : The target max inactivity timeout value is 60 seconds
* If there is an authenticated user then the target max inactivity timeout value is bumped to 10 minutes
* The original max inactivity timeout is stored inside the session itself
* The new target value is set as the max inactivity timeout on the session

2. On the subsequent request :
* The original max inactivity timeout is restored (likely to be about 5 hours depending on tomcat setup)

3. So if a 2nd request is posted within the 1 - 10 minutes mark, then the session expands to full life time.

h4. Problem faced
Session is not terminated even if only 1 request created (supposedly it should be deleted after 60 seconds). Curl command as below is used:
{code}
curl -u rest:rest http://localhost:8523/rest/auth/1/session
{code}
After 10 minutes, session is still not deleted although no activity is performed under this session.
fields.summary: REST session not terminated

fields.description:
By the default, the standard *Complete Date/Time Format* is shown as *dd/MMM/yy h:mm a* and the *Day/Month/Year Format* is *dd/MMM/yy*:
!default_look_and_feel.JPG!

However, when the format is changed as per the following:
!edited_look_and_feel.JPG!

The following error will be shown when the *Version Release* date is changed according to the format that was specified in the *Look and Feel*:
!version_date.JPG!

The current workaround to this issue is to directly choose the date from the date picker:
!version_date_picker.JPG!
fields.summary: Date / Time Formats change is not reflected in the Version Release Date change

fields.description:
Problem Example:
* Pie Chart gadget using a saved filter with configured columns
* Click on the Pie Chart to see load issue navigator's results
* Note that the columns are the default Issue Navigator columns and not what was saved with the original filter

Expected Results:
* Clicking the Pie Chart results into the Issue Navigator would show the same columns as what's saved into the original filter.

Cause:
* Gadgets actually modify the saved filter as needed to help generate the appropriate stats/ordering, thus creating a new filter
** this new filter would not recognize the saved columns of the original.

Tested on: JIRA 4.4.5 and 5.2.4.1

See screenshots
fields.summary: Clicking into a Gadget's Filter does not use the saved Filter Columns
Unable to transition an issue using REST API on Atlassian Developer Toolbox 2.0.3

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31314].
  {panel}

The out-of-the-box "Assigned to Me" filter currently does not include resolved issues in the filter results.

A number of other users have inquired about this and the suggested work-around is to build a custom filter and use the Filter Results gadget.

Many new users to JIRA expect that the "Assigned to Me" does indeed reflect what's in their "inbox" - they do not know intuitively that it excludes resolved issues.

A nice enhancement would be to include an option to include unresolved issues (perhaps in the form of a checkbox on the gadgets configuration screen).
fields.summary: Assigned to Me Gadget should have option for including unresolved issues

fields.description:
h4. Actual behavior:
When mails are sent from Outlook Web Access using Rich Text options, JIRA won't process the body of the mail.

{code}
2012-12-27 13:17:13,831 QuartzWorker-1 INFO ServiceRunner    JIRA Default Comment Handler [atlassian.mail.incoming.mailfetcherservice] JIRA Default Comment Handler[10200]: Added comment ' 'by 'user' to issue 'ATL-01'
{code}

As it's shown in the logs, the {{Added comment}} is blank.

h4. Steps to reproduce:

# Configure JIRA's mail handler to create issues and add comments.
# Send an email from Outlook Web Access using Rich Text formatting.

h4. Expected behavior:

JIRA renders the email properly.

h4. Workaround:

Send the email as plain text.
fields.summary: Comments not added when coming from OWA with Rich Text

fields.description:
When trying to bulk add labels, which we frequently do when e.g. tracking feature request / epics, users keep complaining that all previous values are lost. This is because they believe that changing labels is additive, but the way it is implemented, it actually replaces all values with the new single label.

This is counter intuitive and after the bulk operation has been performed, the labels are gone and it is really difficult to manually restore them.

This needs to be fixed / improved since other way less advanced tools offer way better support here (e.g. Mingle).
fields.summary: Bulk changing labels removes all values

fields.description:
Custom field not showing in Issue Navigator even when filters limited to those the custom field is set for

I've read through https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Custom+Field+Not+Appearing+in+Issue+Navigator+Search+Criteria and whilst that's useful even if I filter down to just the project and issue type that the custom field is set to the field is still now showing in the issue navigator.

Steps taken;
1) Set up a custom field called "Due Date" linked to project A, and issue types x, y and z.
2) Created issues with the Due Date field populated
3) Gone to Issue Navigator to create a filter
4) Added the Due Date field to Issue Navigator using the Tools >>> Configure Columns option
5) Filtered for Project A, issue types x, y, and z
6) Due Date column not displayed as requested.

Strangely, if I apply an extra filter using the Custom Field Due Date e.g. choose a Due Date (after) value, the column then displays and is populated for all records?
fields.summary: Custom field not showing in Issue Navigator even when filters limited to those the custom field is set for

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31310].
  {panel}

How to reproduce:
1. Go to https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/secure/Signup!default.jspa
2. Fill all fields with proper data. Fill captcha field with value that doesn't match the image.
3. Push sign up button

The page will reload and no error message will be displayed.

I've tested that on Google Chrome. Tested with 3 JIRA versions (current ondemand, 5.2.4 (JAC), 5.1.6).

The attachment shows page after submitting the form.

All other fields correctly shows errors when invalid value is provided.
fields.summary: Sign-up form doesn't shows error message when incorrect captcha is provided - the page just reloads without proper message

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31302].
  {panel}

For Project Versions, the *Description* field does not appear to contain a character limit. As a result, descriptions can extend beyond the CSS borders, creating scroll bars. 
 
Also, the description field is 1 continuous field without formatting options. We have a customer inquiring about how to add a line to the description:

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/102740/project-versions-how-can-i-add-a-new-line-in-the-description-of-a-version?page=1#124356 

IMO, if the description field was limited in character size, it might also make adding descriptions more intuitive. It does not seem intuitive to allow  a lot of text into the field unless we compliment it with formatting options (line breaks, bolding, italics, etc). 

Cheers,
Jason | Atlassian
fields.summary: Project Versions > description fields extends CSS border

Bug: The dialog shows the previous issue key and not the currently selected issue key.

fields.description:
*Steps to Replicate*

# create a radio custom field with
## One global context with a field value 'Job Priority'

fields.description:
When viewing project permissions the names of permissions are not translated. 

h5. Steps to Reproduce
- Set a non-default language in JIRA's General Configuration
-- Spanish for example
- Notice there are several strings not being translated. The property value is being overruled as the translated string appears to be picked up:
!no_translation.png|thumbnail!

Original description below:
{quote}
For more info see https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-28198?focusedCommentId=429561&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-429561

I also try to fix it and I think I did. I did not test fully yet. But correct text is showing as permission name and InProduct Translation lists new value as available for translation. 
  
I made changes in 

package com.atlassian.jira.projectconfig.contextproviders;
...
public class ProjectPermissionContextProvider implements CacheableContextProvider
...
method  private List<SimplePermission> getPermission(I18nHelper i18nHelper, GenericValue scheme, Collection<Permission> permissions)

I replaced this line 

 returnPermissions.add(new SimplePermission(Permissions.getShortName(Integer.valueOf(permission.getId())), permission.getName()), permission.getDescription(), entityDisplays));

with this line 

 returnPermissions.add(new SimplePermission(Permissions.getShortName(Integer.valueOf(permission.getId())), i18nHelper.getText(permission.getNameKey()), permission.getDescription(), entityDisplays));
{quote}
fields.summary: project config plugin does not translate permission names

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce*

# Navigate to an issue.
# Open the "Watchers" dialog.
# Add a user with an ampersand (&) in their username as a watcher.
# Attempt to remove the user.
# Refresh the page.

!Watchers.png!

*Expected Result*

On page refresh, the user should no longer be watching the issue.

*Result*

The user is still watching the issue. This is because we're not URL escaping their username.

!Request.png!
fields.summary: Usernames aren't escaped in remove watcher requests

fields.description:
Currently it's only possible to import an OnDemand export during JIRA's initial setup wizard.

This request is for the ability to import an OnDemand export using JIRA's restore from backup feature ( aka JIRA has existing data -> admin -> restore )
fields.summary: Ability to import an OnDemand export with existing JIRA data
Allow Blog Posts (Blogposts) to be added as Issue Links in JIRA

Allow custom field configuration screen to paginate and search select options

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31291].
{panel}
h4. Summary
By default Jira ships with settings to accept only 2 digits for year values in dates.  This causes ambiguity for dates of events that are several years in the future or past because of the inherit loss of precision that comes with trying to store a four digit value like a year with only two digits.

h4. Steps to reproduce:
 # Create or edit an issue and set the Due Date to 12/31/2031 or any date after that.

h4. Expected behavior:

Jira should set the correct date.

h4. Actual results:

You pick a date after 12/31/2031 it will yield a date from early 1900's.

For example, picking 12/31/2032 yields 12/31/1932 when the field is saved.

 !Screenshot 2020-12-18 at 16.17.32.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Workaround:

A Jira Administrator can change the input settings and the look and feel setting so that all dates in Jira will always use 4 digit years instead of 2 digit years.  This will help to avoid the problem when users are setting values going forward.

1. ⚙︎ -> System -> General configuration -> Advanced settings:

!advancedset1.png|thumbnail!

Change 4 values on this page
 # *jira.date.picker.java.format*
 # *jira.date.picker.javascript.format*
 # *jira.date.time.picker.java.format*
 # *jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format*

For the java fields change the 'yy' portion to 'yyyy'. For the javascript entries, the syntax is different, you have change '%y' to '%Y'.   So for example if *jira.date.picker.java.format* has a current value of 'd/MMM/yy' (without quotes) you would change this to 'd/MMM/yyyy'.

2. ⚙︎ -> System -> User Interface -> Look and Feel

!lookfeel1.png|thumbnail!
 The look and feels settings also need to be updated. Change the year values here from 'yy' to be 'yyyy'.
fields.summary: JIRA Date Picker not working for dates after 2031

fields.description:
I have a workflow, and a workflow scheme for a project. In this workflow, I have a step name 'Waiting'. I have a Transition 'On Hold' that leads from the 'Open' and 'In Progress' states to 'Waiting'. The assignee of an issue can perform that transition with no validation. This workflow is active, and the project in question is using it as part of it's workflow scheme.

If my reading of the documentation is correct, an issue assigned to me in the 'Open' state should be allowed to move to 'Waiting' via the 'On Hold' transition. However, that transition / state is not available to me for issues in that state (or on 'In Progress').

I've attached screenshots of the workflow, transitions, etc. If you need more info, please let me know.
fields.summary: Transition not available

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a large number of Issue Security Levels are used, the performance of JIRA degrades.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
This issue was observed with the following:
# 40,000 Issues
# ~200+ Groups
# ~2,000 Users
# More than 20 Security Levels (with group and project roles).

With this configuration, attempting to open the "Assign To Me" gadget would take more than 10 seconds.


h3. Expected Results
The performance of JIRA should not be adversely impacted by Security levels. 

h3. Actual Results
Defining many Security Levels leads to a degradation of performance with JIRA.

h3. Notes
This is a known behaviour and is documented under: [Configuring Issue-level Security|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Issue-level+Security]

h3. Diagnostics
# Executing the below SQL on the instance will identify the total number of issue security levels:
{code:SQL}
select scheme, count(security) from schemeissuesecurities group by scheme;
{code}
# If this is 20 or higher it's likely you're encountering this bug.

h3. Workarounds:
# Reduce the issue security levels.
# Reduce the number of groups using in each level
fields.summary: JIRA search slowness when JIRA has a huge number of issue security levels
Installer should throw error message when service install failed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31285].
  {panel}

h4. Summary
When inline edit is *ON*, clicking the description box will enable quick edit. Meanwhile, clicking anywhere outside quick edit will automatically saves the edit. However, user might accidentally made changes to the description.

h4. Suggestion
A prompt to save/cancel button will be helpful
fields.summary: Inline edit should prompt user before saving

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31283].
  {panel}

h4. Summary
The documentation on [Using Quick Search|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Using+Quick+Search] should be edited to prevent misleading guide. This is because Quick Search does not support searching multiple words.  For example, searching for resolution like "Cannot Reproduce" will not shows all results with the same resolution. Other issues with not "Cannot Reproduce" will also be shown. However, in documentation, the resolution, for instance, consists of two words: {{cannot reproduce}}.

h4. Improvement Request
This has been raised here: [JRA-5114|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-5114]
fields.summary: Documentation on Quick Search should be edited
Add Source and Reviews tabs to fix version screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31279].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Browser Information is not being collected at all the Issue Collector when the environment field is not on the default screen in the given project.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an empty JIRA instance
# Create a new project on that instance
# Create an issue collector inside the project making sure that the "Collect browser information" checkbox is checked
# Embed the issue collector on some website (e.g. http://jsbin.com/)
# Create issue using embeded collector
# Navigate to the issue

h3. Expected Results
The new issue should have the browser information stored in the environment field.

h3. Actual Results
The new issue doesn't have the environment field and it doesn't have the browser information.
 
h3. Notes
The reason it happens seems to be that the environment field is no longer on default screens for projects and therefore is discarded during issue creation.

h3.Workaround
To work around this issue add the environment system field to the *default* create screen in the project you set up the issue collector. New issues created in this project using issue collector will have the browser information collected in the environment field.
fields.summary: Browser Information not collected in Issue Collector in Cloud

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31273].
  {panel}

To reproduce:

# Export a known good workflow as XML
# Find the linked status IDs for any step and replace them with IDs that do not refer to statuses
# Re-import the workflow and use it in a project

This means that workflows could be made active which contain steps without a valid status. I have not attempted to transition an issue to such a step, but I suspect it would either make the transition fail, or corrupt the issue because the status does not exist.

As a platform it would be nice if JIRA could maintain the integrity of this data so that GreenHopper doesn't have to second-guess it.
fields.summary: JIRA Workflow XML import does not validate statuses which are linked to steps

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31268].
  {panel}

Interface #1. Drag and drop window appears:
- When choosing Add, Attachment in page View mode
- When choosing Insert, Image in page Edit mode

Interface #2. Choose File only appears:
- When choosing insert, attachment in page Edit mode

This is confusing and causes me to switch modes when adding files.  Please elimnate Interface #2 and always use Interface #1, allowing drag and drop in all contexts.
fields.summary: Attach file dialogue is inconsistent between workflows/contexts.
Remove "CVS Modules" link from Project Overview "Settings" in OnDemand

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31266].
  {panel}

The start-jira.sh script could correctly set the JAVA_HOME variable for users by:

# using uname to detect 'darwin'

# if uname is 'darwin', set JAVA_HOME to `/usr/libexec/java_home`
e.g. export JAVA_HOME=`/usr/libexec/java_home`

See this post by Apple Inc.

http://lists.apple.com/archives/java-dev/2011/Jul/msg00172.html

Putting all these pieces together, the script is:


{code}
case "`uname`" in
  Darwin*) if [ -z "$JAVA_HOME" ] ; then
             JAVA_HOME=`/usr/libexec/java_home`
           fi
           ;;
esac
{code}
to remove the need to force OS X users to setup a JAVA_HOME variable.
fields.summary: Reduce installation friction by setting JAVA_HOME correctly under OS X

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31265].
  {panel}

This functionality seems to work sometimes work but 

a) Does not always echo back the same way it does in confluence. As I recall, sometimes you can type in the @ and your team list will appear and echo what you type, sometimes nothing appears, but when you type @teammember  and save the issue the link shows up.
b) In some contexts nothing happens at all, either when you type the @ or when you try to type @teammember and save. No dice.

To be honest, I'm not exactly sure how often it's working, just know it doesn't always work, leading me to pull hair. (Well, kinda)

It would be most helpful if this functionality worked from *every* issue comment view, including:
- Workflows, 
- Edit issue, 
- Full issue page, 
- Green Hopper commenting

There are many ways you can comment, and IMHO they should all behave the same way, or your users will be required to avoid certain forms in favor of the ones that work right.

I get so used to typing @ in Confluence that it bums me out when nothing happens in Jira. And then when it appears to work sometimes and not others, it's a bit crazy making.
fields.summary: Inconsistent function of @ mention of team member in comments and description, similar to Confluence shortcut.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31264].
  {panel}

It would be most helpful if this functionality worked from *every* issue comment view, including:
- Workflows, 
- Edit issue, 
- Full issue page, 
- Green Hopper commenting

This is really an issue of supporting integration of both systems. I get so used to typing [ in Confluence that it bums me out when nothing happens in Jira and I have to manually find the link button and click it.
fields.summary: Trigger links to Confluence pages from linked Confluence space using [ key in comments and description, similar to Confluence shortcut.
